definitions.definition: making you feel very sad, usually because somebody has died or suffered a lot

examples.text: He was killed in a tragic accident at the age of 24.
Cuts in the health service could have tragic consequences for patients.
It would be tragic if her talent remained unrecognized.

definitions.definition: connected with tragedy (= the style of literature)

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: from French tragique, via Latin from Greek tragikos, from tragos ‘goat’, but associated with tragōidia (see tragedy).
